summary: On March 30, 1981, U.S. President Ronald Reagan was shot by John Hinckley Jr. in Washington, D.C. Hinckley did this to impress actress Jodie Foster. Reagan was badly hurt but recovered. Three others were also wounded, including White House press secretary James Brady, who later died from his injuries. Hinckley was found not guilty by reason of insanity and spent years in a psychiatric hospital before being released in 2016.
title: Attempted assassination of Ronald Reagan
